intro: Neonauclea celebica, commonly known as the Celebes neonauclea, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
